## Intra-class Correlation

----

### ICC definition  

- ${ICC = \frac{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 }{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 + {\sigma}_{e}^2}}$
- Analysis of variance (ANOVA) model: ${\sigma}_{B}^2(Y_{ij}) = {\sigma}_{b}^2 + {\sigma}_{e}^2$
- Random effect model: $y = {\mu}_{0} + {\lambda}_{i} + {\epsilon}_{ij}$, ${\lambda}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\lambda}^2)$, ${\epsilon}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2)$


The observed individual variation ${\sigma}_{B}^2$ between $Y_{ij}$ (i: repetitions, j: subjects) contains the true between-individual variation ${\sigma}_{b}^2$ across subjects and the within-individual variations (e.g. residual variation ${\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2$).

### ICC models 

---- 

#### 1. one-way random model

- $y = {\mu}_{0} + {\lambda}_{j} + {\epsilon}_{ij}$, ${\lambda}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\lambda}^2)$, ${\epsilon}_{ij} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2)$
- i: repetitions (e.g. sessions, scans, sites, etc.), j: subjects

In **R** package **lme4** with ReML (Restricted Maximum Likelihood)
```
lmer(y ~ 1 + (1|subID), REML=TRUE)
```


- ${ICC = \frac{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 }{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 + {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2}}$
- ${\sigma}_{b}^2$ variation between individuals
- ${\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2$ variation of residuals 

----

#### 2. two-way random model 
- $y = {\mu}_{0} + {\lambda}_{j} + {\alpha}_{j} + {\epsilon}_{ij}$, ${\lambda}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\lambda}^2)$, ${\alpha}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\alpha}^2)$, ${\epsilon}_{ij} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2)$
- i: repetitions (e.g. sessions, scans, sites, etc.), j: subjects

In **R** package **lme4** with ReML (Restricted Maximum Likelihood)
```
lmer(y ~ 1 + (1|session) + (1|subID), REML=TRUE)
```


- ${ICC = \frac{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 }{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 + {\sigma}_{s}^2 + {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2}}$
- ${\sigma}_{b}^2$ variation between individuals
- ${\sigma}_{s}^2$ variation between sessions
- ${\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2$ variation of residuals 


----

#### 3. two-way mixed model 
- $y = {\mu}_{0} + {\lambda}_{j} + {\alpha}_{j} + {\epsilon}_{ij}$, ${\lambda}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\lambda}^2)$, ${\alpha}_{j} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\alpha}^2)$, ${\epsilon}_{ij} \sim N(0, {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2)$
- i: repetitions (e.g. sessions, scans, sites, etc.), j: subjects

In **R** package **lme4** with ReML (Restricted Maximum Likelihood)
```
lmer(y ~ 1 + session + (1|subID), REML=TRUE)
```


- ${ICC = \frac{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 }{ {\sigma}_{b}^2 + {\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2}}$
- ${\sigma}_{b}^2$ variation between individuals
- ${\sigma}_{\epsilon}^2$ variation of residuals
